climbs.name: The Red Pill
climbs.fa: Matt Scherer, Tamas Carli and Jeb Casey  4/5/2021 ground up.

content.description: Begin climbing up the gully on the SW edge of the No Eraser formation, climb left out of the gully onto a ledge. From the ledges gain the right curving flake and follow it to a bolt. At the bolt climb to gain chicken heads and then follow large crystals up to another bolt. Moving up and right from the last bolt, gain the SW ridge of the formation and continue to the summit. A very quality route that will test your footwork. Established the same day as (The Blue Pill).
content.protection: 00 C3 - #2, RPs, 2 bolts, 1 fixed pin, slings for chicken heads.

content.description: I've stared at this line several times in the past... Now it's an awesome 2-pitch adventure outing. We opted for the less direct, but cleaner start in the chimney out right. This checked in at about 5.9 with a sparsely protected beginning before the chimney and finishes on low angle terrain to a nice belay ledge. The 2nd pitch can be tricky but the face holds help a lot. Exit left at the top.
This tower was first summited by Dennis Horning and Bob McRae in 1972
